Package Index | Class Index
public interface

CacheCostFactor

com.sap.cloud.mobile.foundation.cache.CacheCostFactor<K>

Class Overview

In parallel to the Cache Replacement Policy, the optional Cost Factor feature described here provides the eviction mechanism for a Cache implementation to remove one or more existing cache entries so that a new item can be added (via put(Object, Object, double)) when the aggregated cost exceeds the maximum total cost:

  1. During cache initialization, the cache implementation should have method(s) to let the user specify the maximum total cost, and a CacheCostFactor instance that implements onExceedMaxCost(List).
  2. When the put(Object, Object, double) is called:
    • The cache implementation first calculates the aggregated cost by adding the current entry's cost to the costs of all existing entries (via getCostOfEntries()).
    • If the aggregated cost is greater than the maximum total cost, user' onExceedMaxCost(List) method is invoked with a list of existing cache entry keys sorted in cost ascending order.
    • onExceedMaxCost(List) returns a list of key(s) to remove.
    • The cache implementation removes the cache entries user selected and proceeds with the put(Object, Object, double).

Note that the Cost Factor can also be used as a mechanism to pin down a certain entry that is deemed important regardless of the Cache Replacement Policy.

Summary

Public Methods
abstract List<K> onExceedMaxCost(List<K> existingKeys)
This method is invoked during put(Object, Object, double) to instruct the cache implementation to remove one or more cache items from a list of existing keys so that a new cache item can be added when the aggregated costs exceeds the maximum cost.

Public Methods

public abstract List<K> onExceedMaxCost (List<K> existingKeys)

This method is invoked during put(Object, Object, double) to instruct the cache implementation to remove one or more cache items from a list of existing keys so that a new cache item can be added when the aggregated costs exceeds the maximum cost.

  1. The cache will remove the entry/entries based on the returned list.
  2. The current put(Object, Object, double) will proceed and the entry will be added successfully.

Parameters
existingKeys a list of keys associated with existing cache entries sorted in cost ascending order
Returns
  • A non-null list of keys selected from the list of existing keys.
